snippet.title: Fashion mogul Chris Burch built a five-star resort on a remote Indonesian island -- and it's officially the best in the world
snippet.content:
Nihi Sumba Island (formerly known as Nihiwatu) was voted the best hotel in the world by for the second year in a row.
The luxury island resort in Indonesia even beat the Brando, Obama's .
Nihi was created by Chris Burch, best known for founding or cofounding several internationally known retail brands - C. Wonder and Tory Burch - and .
Burch, together with hotelier James McBride, bought a beach hostel on the Indonesian island of Sumba in 2012. The duo spent $US30 million renovating the hostel, then reopened it as a five-star resort in 2015.
In an interview with in 2015, Burch said, "I bought it for my children and as a piece of something that I hope we can preserve and give back to the community. When you're in a place where the palette is so beautiful, you can do things that you can't do in other places: build a spa under a waterfall, go to places where no others have been, have a butler in every room."
According to the , Burch splits his time between Miami, the Hamptons, and his resort in Indonesia. Nihi has 27 private villas, including Raja Mendaka, Burch's private home. That particular section has a main house and four additional villas, each with its own private plunge pool.
